info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 27 at 3:50PM CST until January 28 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy lake effect snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches likely for areas that see lake effect snow. Significant localized snow accumulations of 6 inches or more possible near the lakeshore. * WHERE...Central and Southern Cook County, IL and Lake County, IN. * WHEN...From midnight CST tonight through Friday morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. Dangerous, rapidly changing travel conditions possible with any lake effect snow showers. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Lake effect snow is expected to develop tonight and continue into Friday morning. Snowfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour along with visibility less than one half mile are possible. Due to the nature of lake effect snow, accumulations and dangerous conditions can vary significantly over just a few miles.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
